en.title: 80/20 Training Rule: Complete Guide to Intensity Distribution

en.content:
{% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %} 80/20 Training Rule: The Secret to Running Faster How elite runners train: 80% easy, 20% hardâ€”and why you should too What is the 80/20 Training Rule? The 80/20 training rule states that runners should do approximately 80% of their training at low intensity (easy pace, Zone 1-2 ) and 20% at moderate to high intensity (Zone 3-5). This principle, backed by decades of research and practiced by elite runners worldwide, optimizes aerobic development while

Lactate threshold (LT) is the exercise intensity at which lactate begins to accumulate in your bloodstream faster than your body can clear it. It represents the fastest pace you can sustain for extended periods (30-60 minutes) before fatigue forces you to slow down. For distance runners, lactate

Polarized training is an intensity distribution model where runners spend approximately 75-85% of training time at low intensity ( Zone 1-2 ) and 10-20% at high intensity (Zone 5), while minimizing time in moderate intensity zones (Zone 3-4). This creates a "polarized" distribution with two

en.title: Running Cadence: Complete Guide to Steps Per Minute & Form
en.description: Complete guide to running cadence: what it is, why 180 spm matters, how to measure it, and proven methods to increase your cadence safely over 12-16 weeks.
en.content:
{% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %} Running Cadence: Complete Guide to Steps Per Minute How to find your optimal cadence and improve running efficiency What is Running Cadence? Running cadence (also called stride rate or turnover) is the number of steps you take per minute while running. It's measured by counting footstrikes of one foot and multiplying by two, or counting total steps for both feet combined. Cadence is one of the most important biomechanical factors affecting running e

en.title: Running Economy: Complete Guide to Efficiency & Performance
en.description: Complete guide to running economy: what it is, factors affecting it, how to measure it, and proven methods to improve your oxygen efficiency for faster running.
en.content:
{% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %} Running Economy: The Secret to Running Faster How to use less energy at the same pace and unlock your running potential What is Running Economy? Running economy (RE) measures how efficiently your body uses oxygen at a given pace. It's expressed as the amount of oxygen consumed (ml/kg) per kilometer run. The lower your oxygen cost at a fixed pace, the better your running economyâ€”meaning you can run faster using the same amount of energy. Think of run

fi.description: How elite runners train: 80% easy, 20% hardâ€”and why you should too

{% block content %} 80/20 Training Rule: The Secret to Running Faster How elite runners train: 80% easy, 20% hardâ€”and why you should too What is the 80/20 Training Rule? The 80/20 training rule states that runners should do approximately 80% of their training at low intensity (easy pace, Zone 1-2 ) and 20% at moderate to high intensity (Zone 3-5). fi.title: Lactate Threshold Testing: Complete Guide for Runners
fi.description: How to find your lactate threshold and use it to optimize marathon training
fi.content:
{% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %} Lactate Threshold Testing: Complete Guide for Runners How to find your lactate threshold and use it to optimize marathon training What is Lactate Threshold? Lactate threshold (LT) is the exercise intensity at which lactate begins to accumulate in your bloodstream faster than your body can clear it. It represents the fastest pace you can sustain for extended periods (30-60 minutes) before fatigue forces you to slow down. For distance runners, lactate

Periodization is the systematic planning of athletic training that divides your marathon preparation into distinct phases, each with specific goals and training stimuli. Rather than training the same way year-round, periodization strategically varies training volume, intensi

fi.title: Marathon Zone Distribution: How to Pace Your 26.2 Miles
fi.description: Science-based zone distribution strategies for optimal marathon performance
fi.content:
{% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %} Marathon Zone Distribution: How to Pace Your 26.2 Miles Science-based zone distribution strategies for optimal marathon performance What is Marathon Zone Distribution? Marathon zone distribution refers to how you allocate time across different intensity zones during a 26.2-mile race. Unlike shorter races where you can sustain higher intensities, marathons require careful pacing to avoid early depletion while maximizing performance. Understanding opt

fi.title: Polarized Training for Runners: Train at Two Extremes
fi.description: Why elite endurance athletes avoid the middleâ€”training very easy and very hard
fi.content:
{% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %} Polarized Training for Runners: Train at Two Extremes Why elite endurance athletes avoid the middleâ€”training very easy and very hard What is Polarized Training? Polarized training is an intensity distribution model where runners spend approximately 75-85% of training time at low intensity ( Zone 1-2 ) and 10-20% at high intensity (Zone 5), while minimizing time in moderate intensity zones (Zone 3-4). This creates a "polarized" distribution with two

fi.content:

{% block content %} Running Cadence: Complete Guide to Steps Per Minute How to find your optimal cadence and improve running efficiency What is Running Cadence? Running cadence (also called stride rate or turnover) is the number of steps you take per minute while running. It's measured by counting footstrikes of one foot and multiplying by two, or counting total steps for both feet combined. Complete Guide for Runners Your aerobic capacity explainedâ€”why it matters and how to improve it | Updated: January 29, 2025 Quick Answer VO2max (maximal oxygen uptake) is the maximum amount of oxygen your body can utilize during intense exercise, measured in ml/kg/min. It represents the ceiling of your aerobic capacity and directly predicts running performance. hi.title: Lactate Threshold Testing: Complete Guide for Runners
hi.description: How to find your lactate threshold and use it to optimize marathon training
hi.content:
{% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %} Lactate Threshold Testing: Complete Guide for Runners How to find your lactate threshold and use it to optimize marathon training What is Lactate Threshold? Lactate threshold (LT) is the exercise intensity at which lactate begins to accumulate in your bloodstream faster than your body can clear it. It represents the fastest pace you can sustain for extended periods (30-60 minutes) before fatigue forces you to slow down. For distance runners, lactate

hi.description: Science-based periodization strategies to prepare for your best marathon performance
hi.content:
{% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %} Marathon Periodization: Complete Training Guide Science-based periodization strategies to prepare for your best marathon performance What is Periodization for Marathon Training? Periodization is the systematic planning of athletic training that divides your marathon preparation into distinct phases, each with specific goals and training stimuli. Rather than training the same way year-round, periodization strategically varies training volume, intensi

hi.title: Marathon Zone Distribution: How to Pace Your 26.2 Miles
hi.description: Science-based zone distribution strategies for optimal marathon performance
hi.content:
{% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %} Marathon Zone Distribution: How to Pace Your 26.2 Miles Science-based zone distribution strategies for optimal marathon performance What is Marathon Zone Distribution? Marathon zone distribution refers to how you allocate time across different intensity zones during a 26.2-mile race. Unlike shorter races where you can sustain higher intensities, marathons require careful pacing to avoid early depletion while maximizing performance. Understanding opt

hi.title: Polarized Training for Runners: Train at Two Extremes
hi.description: Why elite endurance athletes avoid the middleâ€”training very easy and very hard
hi.content:
{% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %} Polarized Training for Runners: Train at Two Extremes Why elite endurance athletes avoid the middleâ€”training very easy and very hard What is Polarized Training? Polarized training is an intensity distribution model where runners spend approximately 75-85% of training time at low intensity ( Zone 1-2 ) and 10-20% at high intensity (Zone 5), while minimizing time in moderate intensity zones (Zone 3-4). This creates a "polarized" distribution with two

hi.title: Zone 3 Tempo Runs: Training in the Sweet Spot
hi.description: How to use moderate-intensity tempo runs to build aerobic strength and race readiness
hi.content:
{% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %} Zone 3 Tempo Runs: Training in the Sweet Spot How to use moderate-intensity tempo runs to build aerobic strength and race readiness What are Zone 3 Tempo Runs? Zone 3 tempo runs are moderate-intensity sustained efforts run at approximately 70-80% of max heart rate or 85-95% of lactate threshold pace . They fall between easy aerobic runs (Zone 2) and hard threshold workouts (Zone 4), occupying the "tempo" zone that builds aerobic strength without exc

hi.title: How to Test VO2max: Complete Guide
hi.description: Laboratory, field, and smartwatch methods to measure your aerobic capacity
hi.content:
{% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %} How to Test VO2max: Complete Guide Laboratory, field, and smartwatch methods to measure your aerobic capacity Why Test Your VO2max? Testing your VO2max (maximal oxygen uptake) provides an objective measure of your aerobic fitness and helps guide training decisions. Whether you're using lab testing, field tests, or smartwatch estimates, understanding your VO2max allows you to: Set appropriate training zones based on your physiology Track fitness impr

ja.title: Lactate Threshold Testing: Complete Guide for Runners
ja.description: How to find your lactate threshold and use it to optimize marathon training
ja.content:
{% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %} Lactate Threshold Testing: Complete Guide for Runners How to find your lactate threshold and use it to optimize marathon training What is Lactate Threshold? Lactate threshold (LT) is the exercise intensity at which lactate begins to accumulate in your bloodstream faster than your body can clear it. It represents the fastest pace you can sustain for extended periods (30-60 minutes) before fatigue forces you to slow down. For distance runners, lactate

ja.description: Science-based periodization strategies to prepare for your best marathon performance
ja.content:
{% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %} Marathon Periodization: Complete Training Guide Science-based periodization strategies to prepare for your best marathon performance What is Periodization for Marathon Training? Periodization is the systematic planning of athletic training that divides your marathon preparation into distinct phases, each with specific goals and training stimuli. Rather than training the same way year-round, periodization strategically varies training volume, intensi

ja.title: Marathon Zone Distribution: How to Pace Your 26.2 Miles
ja.description: Science-based zone distribution strategies for optimal marathon performance
ja.content:
{% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %} Marathon Zone Distribution: How to Pace Your 26.2 Miles Science-based zone distribution strategies for optimal marathon performance What is Marathon Zone Distribution? Marathon zone distribution refers to how you allocate time across different intensity zones during a 26.2-mile race. Unlike shorter races where you can sustain higher intensities, marathons require careful pacing to avoid early depletion while maximizing performance. Understanding opt

ja.title: Polarized Training for Runners: Train at Two Extremes
ja.description: Why elite endurance athletes avoid the middleâ€”training very easy and very hard
ja.content:
{% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %} Polarized Training for Runners: Train at Two Extremes Why elite endurance athletes avoid the middleâ€”training very easy and very hard What is Polarized Training? Polarized training is an intensity distribution model where runners spend approximately 75-85% of training time at low intensity ( Zone 1-2 ) and 10-20% at high intensity (Zone 5), while minimizing time in moderate intensity zones (Zone 3-4). This creates a "polarized" distribution with two

ja.title: Zone 3 Tempo Runs: Training in the Sweet Spot
ja.description: How to use moderate-intensity tempo runs to build aerobic strength and race readiness
ja.content:
{% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %} Zone 3 Tempo Runs: Training in the Sweet Spot How to use moderate-intensity tempo runs to build aerobic strength and race readiness What are Zone 3 Tempo Runs? Zone 3 tempo runs are moderate-intensity sustained efforts run at approximately 70-80% of max heart rate or 85-95% of lactate threshold pace . They fall between easy aerobic runs (Zone 2) and hard threshold workouts (Zone 4), occupying the "tempo" zone that builds aerobic strength without exc

ko.title: Running Cadence: Complete Guide to Steps Per Minute
ko.description: How to find your optimal cadence and improve running efficiency
ko.content:
{% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %} Running Cadence: Complete Guide to Steps Per Minute How to find your optimal cadence and improve running efficiency ëŸ¬ë‹ ì¼€ì´ë˜ìŠ¤ë€? Running cadence (also called stride rate or turnover) is the number of steps you take per minute while running. It's measured by counting footstrikes of one foot and multiplying by two, or counting total steps for both feet combined. Cadence is one of the most important biomechanical factors affecting running economy , injury

ko.title: Zone 3 Tempo Runs: Training in the Sweet Spot
ko.description: How to use moderate-intensity tempo runs to build aerobic strength and race readiness
ko.content:
{% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %} Zone 3 Tempo Runs: Training in the Sweet Spot How to use moderate-intensity tempo runs to build aerobic strength and race readiness What are Zone 3 Tempo Runs? Zone 3 tempo runs are moderate-intensity sustained efforts run at approximately 70-80% of max heart rate or 85-95% of lactate threshold pace . They fall between easy aerobic runs (Zone 2) and hard threshold workouts (Zone 4), occupying the "tempo" zone that builds aerobic strength without exc

ko.title: How to Test VO2max: Complete Guide
ko.description: Laboratory, field, and smartwatch methods to measure your aerobic capacity
ko.content:
{% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %} How to Test VO2max: Complete Guide Laboratory, field, and smartwatch methods to measure your aerobic capacity Why Test Your VO2max? Testing your VO2max (maximal oxygen uptake) provides an objective measure of your aerobic fitness and helps guide training decisions. ko.content: VO2maxë€? ëŸ¬ë„ˆë¥¼ ìœ„í•œ ì™„ë²½ ê°€ì´ë“œ Your aerobic capacity explainedâ€”why it matters and how to improve it | Updated: January 29, 2025 Quick Answer VO2max (maximal oxygen uptake) is the maximum amount of oxygen your body can utilize during intense exercise, measured in ml/kg/min. It represents the ceiling of your aerobic capacity and directly predicts running performance. ms.title: Peraturan Latihan 80/20: Rahsia untuk Berlari Lebih Pantas
ms.description: Cara atlet elit berlatih: 80% mudah, 20% kerasâ€”dan mengapa anda juga perlu melakukannya
ms.content:
{% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %} Peraturan Latihan 80/20: Rahsia untuk Berlari Lebih Pantas Cara atlet elit berlatih: 80% mudah, 20% kerasâ€”dan mengapa anda juga perlu melakukannya Apakah Peraturan Latihan 80/20? Peraturan latihan 80/20 menyatakan bahawa pelari seharusnya melakukan kira-kira 80% daripada latihan mereka pada intensiti rendah (rentak mudah, Zon 1-2 ) dan 20% pada intensiti sederhana hingga tinggi (Zon 3-5). ms.content: Tentang Run Analytics Penjejakan prestasi larian berasaskan sains, dibina oleh pelari untuk pelari Misi Kami Run Analytics membawa penjejakan prestasi gred profesional kepada setiap pelari. ms.content:
{% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %} Fasa Pembinaan Asas: Asas Kejayaan Berlari Cara membina asas aerobik yang menyokong latihan lebih pantas dan mencegah kecederaan Apakah Pembinaan Asas? Pembinaan asas adalah fasa latihan asas di mana pelari membangunkan kapasiti aerobik melalui larian volum tinggi, intensiti rendah. ms.content: Run Analytics berbanding Aplikasi Larian Lain - Perbandingan Ciri Bagaimana Run Analytics berbanding dengan Strava, TrainingPeaks, Final Surge, dan platform penjejakan larian lain Mengapa Larian Memerlukan Analitik Khusus Aplikasi kecergasan umum seperti Strava dan TrainingPeaks cemerlang dalam berbasikal dan larian, tetapi larian memerlukan metrik yang berbeza . Critical Run Speed (CRS), zon latihan berasaskan kadar, dan mekanik langkah tidak disokong dengan betul dalam platform pelbagai sukan.

ms.content: Hubungi Run Analytics Kami ingin mendengar daripada anda! Sama ada anda mempunyai soalan tentang analitik larian, memerlukan bantuan dengan ujian CRS, ingin melaporkan pepijat, atau mempunyai cadangan ciri, kami sedia membantu. nl.title: 80/20 Training Rule: Het Geheim om Sneller te Lopen
nl.description: Hoe elite hardlopers trainen: 80% rustig, 20% hardâ€”en waarom jij dat ook zou moeten doen
nl.content:
{% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %} 80/20 Training Rule: Het Geheim om Sneller te Lopen Hoe elite hardlopers trainen: 80% rustig, 20% hardâ€”en waarom jij dat ook zou moeten doen Wat is de 80/20 Training Rule? De 80/20 training rule stelt dat hardlopers ongeveer 80% van hun training op lage intensiteit moeten doen (rustig tempo, Zone 1-2 ) en 20% op matige tot hoge intensiteit (Zone 3-5). Dit principe, ondersteund door decennia van onderzoek en toegepast door elite hardlopers wereldwijd

Kanuni ya mafunzo 80/20 inasema kwamba wakimbizi wanapaswa kufanya takriban 80% ya mafunzo yao kwa ukali wa chini (kasi rahisi, Eneo 1-2 ) na 20% kwa ukali wa wastani hadi juu (Eneo 3-5). tl.title: Alituntuning 80/20 sa Pagsasanay: Ang Lihim sa Mas Mabilis na Pagtakbo
tl.description: Paano nagsasanay ang mga elite runner: 80% madali, 20% mabigatâ€”at bakit dapat mo ring gawin ito
tl.content:
{% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %} Alituntuning 80/20 sa Pagsasanay: Ang Lihim sa Mas Mabilis na Pagtakbo Paano nagsasanay ang mga elite runner: 80% madali, 20% mabigatâ€”at bakit dapat mo ring gawin ito Ano ang Alituntuning 80/20 sa Pagsasanay? Ang alituntuning 80/20 sa pagsasanay ay nagsasaad na ang mga runner ay dapat gumawa ng humigit-kumulang 80% ng kanilang pagsasanay sa mababang intensidad (madaling bilis, Zone 1-2 ) at 20% sa katamtaman hanggang mataas na intensidad (Zone 3-5).

Base building ay ang pangunahing yugto ng pagsasanay kung saan ang mga runners ay bumubuo ng aerobic capacity sa pamamagitan ng mataas na volume at mababang intensity na pagtakbo. tl.title: Critical Running Speed (CRS)

tl.content: Critical Running Speed (CRS) Ang Pundasyon ng Data-Driven na Pagsasanay sa Pagtakbo Mga Pangunahing Punto Ano: Ang critical running speed (CRS) ay ang iyong pinakamataas na sustainable running paceâ€”ang aerobic threshold kung saan makakaya mong manatiling tumakbo nang 30+ minuto Paano Kalkulahin: Magsagawa ng 400m at 200m time trials, pagkatapos gamitin: CRS = (400m time - 200m time) / 2 para sa pace bawat 100m Bakit Mahalaga: Ang CRS ay nagbibigay ng personalized training zones , tumpak na TSS c

tl.title: Libreng Running TSS Calculator

tl.content: Libreng Running TSS Calculator Kalkulahin ang Training Stress Score para sa running workouts - Ang tanging libreng sTSS calculator Ano ang Running TSS (sTSS)? Running Training Stress Score (sTSS) ay sumusukat ng training load ng isang running workout sa pamamagitan ng pagsasama ng intensity at duration. Ito ay inangkop mula sa TSS methodology ng cycling, gamit ang iyong Critical Run Speed (CRS) bilang threshold pace. Ang 1-oras na workout sa CRS pace = 100 sTSS. Libreng sTSS Calculator Kalkulahi
